title: What should I know before applying for the CBSE improvement exam, and how do I do that? - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: CBSE Improvement Exam is a way to improve your Class 12th result by re-appearing for CBSE board exam. Students are allowed to give the exam in one or all subjects; there is no restriction on the number of subjects one can give improvement in. Before appearing for the improvement exam, candidates must note that every candidate is allowed not more than one attempt in the succeeding year. MERITS AND DEMERITS OF CBSE IMPROVEMENT EXAM Advantages: If a student scores improved marks in all the subjects he/she has filled for improvement, there is no need for combining two marksheets.It helps (rather gives candidate a golden opportunity) candidates improve their result, in case he/she has not scored well in the regular board exam.Disadvantages: If a student does not score well in the improvement exam, then he/she will have to produce both the marksheets wherever required/demanded.CBSE improvement exam marksheet has only the subjects in which the student has appeared for improvement, not the previous subjects.The improvement exam marksheet is different from the regular board exam result. “APPEARED FOR IMPROVEMENT” is mentioned on the CBSE Improvement Exam marksheet.Details for CBSE Improvement Exam The application forms for Improvement examination are usually available from the month of July onward.Each form will cost Rs.10.The fees per subject to be submitted is Rs.200 (subject to change).The forms can be collected from Syndicate Bank branches throughout Delhi and Regional Offices of CBSE for other regions.The Application Forms will be released in August until October and can be collected from regional offices or syndicate bank branches.Candidates will be issued only Statement of Marks reflecting the marks of the improvement examination.

For applying cbse improvement there is following procedure 1 improvement has no linkage with former school. 2 improvement form usually comes in October 3 In the form you have to fill subject in which you want to give improvement (For IIT jee Mains and advance you can give improvement in one subject also) 4 You have to pay extra practical fee for the subject in practical subject like physics chemistry even though your previous previous score will be carry forward . 5 You have to speed post the acknowledgement page as well as your 12th marksheet to cbse regional office . It is not necessary that you give improvement from the city where you passed class 12 You can give improvement from any city of any state For more clarity I am attaching screenshot of information bulletin page.
